item.description:
The U.S. wars in Afghanistan and Pakistan are escalating. Saber-rattling against Iran is reaching dangerous levels. Extra-urban U.S. bases in Iraq are expanding in size and permanence. Meanwhile the U.S. government refuses to use its power to break the siege of Gaza.

What can we do here, in our region, to rebuild the movement and our ability to mobilize the antiwar majority?

Come hear and discuss proposals for a one-day regional strategy session in January, for spring demonstrations, and for a large regional educational conference and plenary to call fall actions.

Perspectives on regional organization, education, and spring mobilizations. Join a discussion initiated by coalition organizers from around the Northeast.

Hear:
Joe Lombardo, Bethlehem (NY) Neighbors for Peace
Lisa Savage, CODEPINK Maine Local Coordinator, PINKTank blogger: www.codepink4peace.org/blog
Chris Gauvreau, Connecticut United for Peace
John Harris, Greater Boston Stop the Wars Coalition and National Assembly liaison for the October 17 mobilizations nationwide
Cole Harrison, Afghanistan Task Force, Boston United for Justice with Peace and an organizer of October 17 march in Boston
Mark Stahl, Rhode Island Mobilization Committee

Business meeting to follow. Planning for January Conference, spring mobilizations, and an April educational conference.

We need you and your group, no matter what your group?s current size! We are rebuilding. JOIN US!
item.name: What CAN We Do to Strengthen the Antiwar Movement?
